Another opinion

It is unfortunate that the strictly one-sided views of the religious right, and particularly the most zealous and closed-minded of that group, get the most press and attention. The great majority of people in the US claim to be religious, yet the polls on various issues show that the majority of people in the US hold a much wider range of views on moral issues than are held by the religious right. It is a pity that one does not hear enough from those with moderate religious views - so the discussions often appears to be more polarized than they actually are. After all, the choice in moral approach is not only between a purely secular or purely religious approach. Given the poll numbers on issues, most people try to balance their belief in God, and what they were taught about morality from their religion, with their own independent thought and secular reasoning.
